trans-unit.source: Emmet support for VS Code
Wrap with Abbreviation
Wrap Individual Lines with Abbreviation
Remove Tag
Update Tag
Go to Matching Pair
Balance (inward)
Balance (outward)
Go to Previous Edit Point
Go to Next Edit Point
Merge Lines
Select Previous Item
Select Next Item
Split/Join Tag
Toggle Comment
Evaluate Math Expression
Update Image Size
Reflect CSS Value
Increment by 1
Decrement by 1
Increment by 0.1
Decrement by 0.1
Increment by 10
Decrement by 10
Define profile for specified syntax or use your own profile with specific rules.
An array of languages where Emmet abbreviations should not be expanded.
Path to a folder containing Emmet profiles and snippets.

Shows expanded Emmet abbreviations as suggestions. The option `"inMarkupAndStylesheetFilesOnly"` applies to html, haml, jade, slim, xml, xsl, css, scss, sass, less and stylus. The option `"always"` applies to all parts of the file regardless of markup/css.
Shows possible Emmet abbreviations as suggestions. Not applicable in stylesheets or when emmet.showExpandedAbbreviation is set to `"never"`.

Enable Emmet abbreviations in languages that are not supported by default. Add a mapping here between the language and emmet supported language. E.g.: `{"vue-html": "html", "javascript": "javascriptreact"}`
Variables to be used in Emmet snippets
When enabled, Emmet abbreviations are expanded when pressing TAB.
Preferences used to modify behavior of some actions and resolvers of Emmet.
Default unit for integer values
Default unit for float values
Symbol to be placed at the end of CSS property when expanding CSS abbreviations
Symbol to be placed at the end of CSS property when expanding CSS abbreviations in Sass files
Symbol to be placed at the end of CSS property when expanding CSS abbreviations in Stylus files
Symbol to be placed at the between CSS property and value when expanding CSS abbreviations
Symbol to be placed at the between CSS property and value when expanding CSS abbreviations in Sass files
Symbol to be placed at the between CSS property and value when expanding CSS abbreviations in Stylus files
If `true`, then Emmet suggestions will show up as snippets allowing you to order them as per `#editor.snippetSuggestions#` setting.
Element separator used for classes when using the BEM filter
Modifier separator used for classes when using the BEM filter
A definition of comment that should be placed before matched element when comment filter is applied.
A definition of comment that should be placed after matched element when comment filter is applied.
A comma-separated list of attribute names that should exist in abbreviation for the comment filter to be applied
An array of tag names that should not get inner indentation
An array of tag names that should always get inner indentation
If true, compact notation of boolean attributes are produced
Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'webkit' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'webkit' prefix.
Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'moz' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'moz' prefix.
Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'o' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'o' prefix.
Comma separated CSS properties that get the 'ms' vendor prefix when used in Emmet abbreviation that starts with `-`. Set to empty string to always avoid the 'ms' prefix.
The minimum score (from 0 to 1) that fuzzy-matched abbreviation should achieve. Lower values may produce many false-positive matches, higher values may reduce possible matches.

When set to `false`, the whole file is parsed to determine if current position is valid for expanding Emmet abbreviations. When set to `true`, only the content around the current position in css/scss/less files is parsed.
